intro: Cacalia phyllolepis, commonly known as the leafy cacalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the familyApiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with finely divided leaflets and small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cacalia phyllolepis is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and pleasant scent.
